div.p: Classes at Innovation focus on higher-order critical thinking skills, emphasizing depth of understanding over breadth of knowledge. Systems Thinking tools are used throughout the curriculum to help students understand the complex relationships and dynamic processes that govern so many of the most fundamental problems our world is facing.

Students apply their thinking to concrete problems throughout the curriculum, working on hands-on projects and presenting their most polished work to a public audience at quality nights and jury days in the middle school and at presentations of learning and exhibition nights in the high school.

Teachers emphasize interdisciplinary connections to help students understand how problem-solving techniques cross the boundaries of traditional disciplines and departments. An emphasis on group work and team building helps students learn that making connections between diverse experiences and perspectives is a crucial skill in all disciplines.

div.h2: Systems Thinking provides a toolkit for thinking critically about complex, dynamic problems.
"I may not be perfect, but IACS helped me find my imperfect self."
The Advisory program provides academic support as well as creating a safe, fun space for students to build social and emotional connections.
Students map the Merrimack in an interdisciplinary course that combines history, geography, and geology.
Students use games and physical interaction to learn Spanish
Presenting work publicly is an integral part of every Innovation student's experience.
7th and 8th graders use systems tools to understand prehistoric population dynamics.
Students learn coding in middle school math
Building a wellness program that takes full advantage of our 200 acre campus
